content.description:
Jam/layback up the right side of three large blocks to a ledge with a tree to the left. From the ledge, follow the narrowing, left-leaning crack to a straight-up crack and the top. Belay from trees or bolts at the lip.

**May need a scrubbing?(June 2019)

Look for the scrubbed swath of rock as you first approach the wall on your right.
Gear to 4".

It’s a good warm up route. You can scramble up and left from the top to reach Upper Perching Wall.

Left of the approach trail to “Polly’s” is an obvious arête.
3 bolts and one finger sized cam (yellow metolius).

P1. - 5.7, 30m. Start at a right leaning corner/roof. Face climb and stem/jam/pull past some large blocks to a bolted rappel anchor at a nice ledge.

P2. - 5.9+, 30m. Follow the crack on the left past the pine tree and up to the open book. Work your way up the corner/crack/arête (your choice) to a bolted rappel anchor at the top. A spectacular and engaging pitch of climbing.

P3. - 5.10-, 20m. Pull through the overhang up and left of the belay, then follow this corner briefly until it ends. Easy climbing up and left leads to a large ledge with a rappel anchor on a hemlock tree.

Descent: From the top of pitch two, two raps off of bolts returns you to the ground. From the top of the third pitch, rap directly down to the top of Big Red, then back to the top of the first pitch of Polly’s. Polly’s can also be reached by rapping in off trees at the far right side of the Upper Perching Wall.

Instead of following the flagged trail to College Girls Gone Wild at the upper-left side of the talus, continue straight up to the left side of the large, white amphitheatre with the arching dihedrals.
Gear to 2".
Interesting crack climbing of the easy/moderate variety
